item.title: Z-Order Curve
item.description: It is possible to arrange multi-dimensional data into an one-dimensional data structure in several ways by defining an ordering pattern, such as Hilbert curve and Z-Order Curve. This type of arrangement provides memory-efficient *-tree representations and helps to maximize cache hit queries on certain types of operations - neighborhood search on grids for example.
